claim: A video shared in early 2024 showed Taylor Swift holding up a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."
content:
On Feb. 4, 2024, a user on X named il Donaldo Trumpo (@PapiTrumpo) – whose account mentions that it posts "a little bit of parody" – posted (archived) a video that appeared to show 14-time Grammy Award-winning recording artist Taylor Swift holding up a flag while walking the red carpet that read, "Trump Won, Democrats Cheated."

While the video may have appeared obviously fake to some users, Elon Musk's social media platform X still showed a label that was displayed under the post that identified it as "manipulated media," adding a link to "find out more" and "stay informed."
The link in the "manipulated media" label led to a policy page on help.twitter.com, which showed that remnants of the old name "Twitter" could still be found on the platform. The page began, "You may not share synthetic, manipulated, or out-of-context media that may deceive or confuse people and lead to harm ('misleading media'). In addition, we may label posts containing misleading media to help people understand their authenticity and to provide additional context."
The original video posted by Variety on Feb. 4 showed Swift simply walking the red carpet and posing for photos, holding no flags or banners of any kind.
Taylor Swift is gorgeous at the #Grammys. https://t.co/Imoq8xlJM9 pic.twitter.com/ydotYDoXFI
— Variety (@Variety) February 5, 2024

As Snopes previously reported, Swift's past expressions of her political beliefs were somewhat the opposite of the idea of embracing false conspiracy theories about the 2020 U.S. presidential election. For example, she previously expressed views in opposition to the politics of former U.S. President Donald Trump and U.S. Sen. Marsha Blackburn of Tennessee – who are both Republicans – in the 2020 documentary "Miss Americana" and on her Instagram account.

original_rationales.main_rationale: The link in the "manipulated media" label led to a policy page on help.twitter.com, which showed that remnants of the old name "Twitter" could still be found on the platform.
original_rationales.additional_rationale1: As Snopes previously reported, Swift's past expressions of her political beliefs were somewhat the opposite of the idea of embracing false conspiracy theories about the 2020 U.S. presidential election.
original_rationales.additional_rationale2: The original video posted by Variety on Feb. 4 showed Swift simply walking the red carpet and posing for photos, holding no flags or banners of any kind.

summary_rationales.synthesized_rationale: The claim that a video showed Taylor Swift holding a flag at the 2024 Grammy Awards with a controversial message was rated as 'Fake.' This rating is supported by the analysis of the video, the labeling of the video as 'manipulated media,' the absence of flags or banners in the original video posted by Variety, and Swift's past expressions of political beliefs contradicting the message in the claimed video.

detailed_reasons.reason1: The video showing Taylor Swift holding a flag with a political message was labeled as 'manipulated media' on Elon Musk's social media platform X. This labeling indicates that the video was intentionally altered to deceive viewers, supporting the 'Fake' rating.
detailed_reasons.reason2: The original video posted by Variety on the same day did not depict Taylor Swift holding any flags or banners, contradicting the claim made in the video shared by il Donaldo Trumpo. The absence of such content in the original video undermines the credibility of the claim.
detailed_reasons.reason3: Swift's known political stance and previous public expressions go against the narrative suggested in the claimed video. Given her past opposition to figures like Donald Trump and Marsha Blackburn, it is highly unlikely that she would openly support the message presented in the video, further discrediting its authenticity.
detailed_reasons.reason4: The policy on misleading media shared in the article emphasizes the platform's efforts to prevent the spread of deceptive content. The guidelines provided align with the evaluation of the video as 'Fake,' highlighting the importance of authentic and contextually accurate information.

evidence1:
Taylor Swift is gorgeous at the #Grammys. https://t.co/Imoq8xlJM9 pic.twitter.com/ydotYDoXFI
— Variety (@Variety) February 5, 2024

relationship_with_evidence.additional_rationale2, evidence1: The evidence provided by Variety, showing Taylor Swift simply walking the red carpet without holding any flags or banners, directly supports the additional rationale that the original video posted by Variety did not depict Taylor Swift holding any flags or banners. This direct contradiction in content undermines the credibility of the claim made in the manipulated video shared by il Donaldo Trumpo, supporting the 'Fake' rating.
